00002 /// @file         CTreeGraphModel.cpp

00011 ///               class which is a wrapper for the CTreeGraph class.  It is
00012 ///               designed to allow for notification of data modification by
00013 ///               requiring that all data modification be done through this

00020 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00021 /// CTreeGraphModel::CTreeGraphModel
00022 ///
00023 /// @description    This is the default constructor for the class and
00024 ///                 initializes member variables.
00025 /// @pre            None
00026 /// @post           Member variables are initialized.
00027 ///
00028 /// @param parent:  This is a pointer to the parent QObject.
00029 ///
00030 /// @limitations    None
00031 ///
00032 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00033 CTreeGraphModel::CTreeGraphModel( QObject *parent )
00034 : QObject( parent )
00035 {
00036     m_data = NULL;
00037     m_style = CStyleToolkit::instance();
00038 }
00039 
00040 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00041 /// CTreeGraphModel::~CTreeGraphModel
00042 ///
00043 /// @description   This is the class destructor which frees up dynamic memory
00044 ///                used by the class.
00045 /// @pre           None
00046 /// @post          None
00047 ///
00048 /// @limitations   None
00049 ///
00050 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00051 CTreeGraphModel::~CTreeGraphModel()
00052 {
00053     //Check if the data structure exists.  If it does, delete it.
00054     if ( m_data != NULL )
00055     {
00056         delete m_data;
00057     }
00058 }

00060 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00061 /// CTreeGraphModel::addChildNode
00062 ///
00063 /// @description   This function adds a new child node to the given node and
00064 ///                places it at the given location.
00065 /// @pre           None
00066 /// @post          A new child node is added to the given node and placed at
00067 ///                the given location.
00068 ///
00069 /// @param node:   This is a pointer to the parent node for the new child node.
00070 /// @param point:  This is the point on the screen where the user wants to place
00071 ///                the new child node.
00072 ///
00073 /// @limitations   None
00074 ///
00075 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00076 void CTreeGraphModel::addChildNode( STreeNode *node, QPoint point )
00077 {
00078     //Create the new node and set the point and parent to the indicated values.
00079     STreeNode *newNode = new STreeNode;
00080     newNode->s_position = point;
00081     newNode->s_parent = node;
00082 
00083     //Add the new node to the child list of the parent node.
00084     node->s_childList.append( newNode );
00085 
00086     //Resort the parent node's child list and signal the canvas to redraw
00087     //the model.
00088     sortChildNodes( node );
00089     emit repaint();
00090     emit retrace();
00091 }
00092 
00093 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00094 /// CTreeGraphModel::addChildNodeBasic
00095 ///
00096 /// @description   This function adds a new child node to the given node and
00097 ///                places it at the origin, without repaint or retrace.
00098 ///                Used for adding many children at once.
00099 /// @pre           None
00100 /// @post          A new child node is added to the given node and placed at
00101 ///                QPoint(0,0). Canvas and trace are not updated.
00102 ///                New child node is returned.
00103 ///
00104 /// @param node:   This is a pointer to the parent node for the new child node.
00105 ///
00106 /// @return STreeNode *:  Returns a pointer to the new child node.
00107 ///
00108 /// @limitations   None
00109 ///
00110 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00111 STreeNode * CTreeGraphModel::addChildNodeBasic( STreeNode *node )
00112 {
00113     //Create the new node and set the parent appropriately.
00114     STreeNode *newNode = new STreeNode;
00115     newNode->s_position = QPoint(0,0);
00116     newNode->s_parent = node;
00117 
00118     //Add the new node to the child list of the parent node.
00119     node->s_childList.append( newNode );
00120     return newNode;
00121 }
00122 
00123 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00124 /// CTreeGraphModel::addParentNode
00125 ///
00126 /// @description  This function inserts a new parent node above the given node.
00127 ///               If the given node is the root node, the new parent node
00128 ///               becomes the new root node.  Otherwise, the new parent node
00129 ///               becomes a child node of the former parent node.
00130 /// @pre          None
00131 /// @post         A node has been inserted as the parent of the indicated node.
00132 ///
00133 /// @param node:  This is a pointer to the node to which a new parent node is
00134 ///               being added.
00135 ///
00136 /// @limitations  None
00137 ///
00138 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00139 void CTreeGraphModel::addParentNode( STreeNode *node )
00140 {
00141     //Create the new parent node.
00142     STreeNode *newNode = new STreeNode;
00143 
00144     //Check if the indicated node was the root node or not.
00145     if ( node->s_parent != NULL )
00146     {
00147         //The indicated node was not the root node, so insert the new parent
00148         //node between the old parent and the indicated node.
00149         int nodeAt = node->s_parent->s_childList.indexOf( node );
00150         node->s_parent->s_childList.removeAt( nodeAt );
00151         node->s_parent->s_childList.insert( nodeAt, newNode );
00152     }
00153     else
00154         //Otherwise, set the new parent node as the new root node.
00155         setRootNode( newNode );
00156 
00157     //Set the new parent's node to the indicated node's old parent.
00158     newNode->s_parent = node->s_parent;
00159 
00160     //Add the indicated node to the new parent's child list.
00161     newNode->s_childList.append( node );
00162 
00163     //Set the indicated node's parent to the new parent node.
00164     node->s_parent = newNode;
00165 
00166     //Place the new parent node where the indicated node was.
00167     newNode->s_position = node->s_position;
00168 
00169     //Shift the indicated node down to make room for the new parent node.
00170     QPoint point( 0, m_style->getNodeRadius() * 3 );
00171     shiftSubTree( node, point );
00172 
00173     //Signal the canvas to redraw the model.
00174     emit repaint();
00175     emit retrace();
00176 }
00177 
00178 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00179 /// CTreeGraphModel::autoLayout
00180 ///
00181 /// @description  This function moves all the nodes to form a nicely spaced out
00182 ///               tree.
00183 /// @pre          None
00184 /// @post         The tree has been arranged.
00185 ///
00186 /// @limitations  None
00187 ///
00188 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00189 void CTreeGraphModel::autoLayout()
00190 {
00191     //This variable is used as the x value of the left most node in the tree.
00192     int x = m_style->getNodeRadius() + m_style->getBoldWidth() +
00193             m_style->getPen().width();
00194 
00195     //Align the x values of all the nodes in the tree.
00196     autoLayoutX( m_data->getRootNode(), x );
00197 
00198     //Set the Y value of the root node to be on the screen.
00199     m_data->getRootNode()->s_position.setY( m_style->getNodeRadius() +
00200                                             m_style->getBoldWidth() +
00201                                             m_style->getPen().width() );
00202 
00203     //Align the y values of all the nodes in the tree.
00204     autoLayoutY( m_data->getRootNode() );
00205 
00206     emit repaint();
00207 }
00208 
00209 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00210 /// CTreeGraphModel::autoLayoutX
00211 ///
00212 /// @description  This function arranges the given node and all its children
00213 ///               such that the left most child (or the given node, if it has
00214 ///               no children), uses the x value indicated.  Any node that has
00215 ///               children will use the average x value of its children to
00216 ///               determine its own x value.  The value x is passed by reference
00217 ///               so it may be continually used to properly space the whole
00218 ///               tree.
00219 /// @pre          X must be the value where the left most node will be placed.
00220 /// @post         The x values for the position of the given node and all its
00221 ///               children have been set.
00222 ///
00223 /// @param node:  This is a pointer to the node which needs to be arranged.
00224 /// @param x:     This is a reference to the position to use for the next node.
00225 ///               When a node uses this value, it increments it for the next
00226 ///               leaf node to use.
00227 ///
00228 /// @limitations  None
00229 ///
00230 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00231 void CTreeGraphModel::autoLayoutX( STreeNode *node, int &x )
00232 {
00233     //This constant is static so as not to redeclare it during the recursive
00234     //funtion call.  It indicates how far apart each node should be.
00235     static const int nodeSpacing = m_style->getNodeRadius() / 2 * 5;
00236 
00237     //Make sure a valid node is passed in.
00238     if ( node == NULL )
00239         return;
00240 
00241     //Check if the given node is a leaf node.
00242     if ( node->s_childList.isEmpty() )
00243     {
00244         //Set the leaf node's x value to the given value.
00245         node->s_position.setX( x );
00246 
00247         //Increment the x value for the next leaf node and return.
00248         x += nodeSpacing;
00249         return;
00250     }
00251 
00252     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00253     //
00254     // Description:   This loop recursively calls this function on
00255     //                the children of the given node to properly
00256     //                set their x values so the given node can set
00257     //                its x value.
00258     //
00259     // Precondition:  The given node must have at least 1 child.
00260     // Postcondition: The children of the given node have had their
00261     //                x values set.
00262     //
00263     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00264     for ( int i = 0; i < node->s_childList.size(); i++ )
00265     {
00266         autoLayoutX( node->s_childList[ i ], x );
00267     }
00268 
00269     //Set the x value of the given node to the average of the child nodes so
00270     //as to center it above its children.
00271     node->s_position.setX( ( node->s_childList.first()->s_position.x() +
00272                              node->s_childList.last()->s_position.x() ) / 2 );
00273 }
00274 
00275 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00276 /// CTreeGraphModel::autoLayoutY
00277 ///
00278 /// @description  This function sets the y value of the given node and its
00279 ///               children for the autoLayout functionality.
00280 /// @pre          The given node must have its y value set to the desired value.
00281 /// @post         The y value of the node and its children have been set.
00282 ///
00283 /// @param node:  This is a pointer to the node which needs to have its
00284 ///               children's y values set.
00285 ///
00286 /// @limitations  None
00287 ///
00288 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00289 void CTreeGraphModel::autoLayoutY( STreeNode *node )
00290 {
00291     //This constant is static so as not to redeclare it during the recursive
00292     //funtion call.  It indicates how far apart each node should be.
00293     static const int nodeSpacing = m_style->getNodeRadius() * 3;
00294 
00295     //Make sure the node passed in is valid.
00296     if ( node == NULL )
00297         return;
00298 
00299     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00300     //
00301     // Description:   This loop recursively calls this function on
00302     //                the children of the given node to properly
00303     //                set their y values.
00304     //
00305     // Precondition:  The y value of the given node is set.
00306     // Postcondition: The children of the given node have had their
00307     //                y values set.
00308     //
00309     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00310     for ( int i = 0; i < node->s_childList.size(); i++ )
00311     {
00312         //Set the y value of the current child node and then call this function
00313         //to arrange the child's children properly.
00314         node->s_childList[ i ]->s_position.setY( node->s_position.y() +
00315                                                  nodeSpacing );
00316         autoLayoutY( node->s_childList[ i ] );
00317     }
00318 }
00319 
00320 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00321 /// CTreeGraphModel::autoName
00322 ///
00323 /// @description  This function names all the nodes alphabetically, starting
00324 ///               with A in a breadth first manner.
00325 /// @pre          None
00326 /// @post         All the nodes are named alphabetically, breadth-first.
00327 ///
00328 /// @limitations  This function can only autoname up to 702 nodes.
00329 ///
00330 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00331 void CTreeGraphModel::autoName()
00332 {
00333     //This variable is used as a loop variable.
00334     int i;
00335 
00336     //These variables are used to store the letters used to make the names for
00337     //the nodes.
00338     char firstLetter = ( 'A' - 1 ), secondLetter = 'A';
00339 
00340     //This list is used for traversing through the tree breadth first.
00341     QList<STreeNode *> nodeList;
00342 
00343     //THis variable is used to store the name of the next node.
00344     QString name;
00345 
00346     //Place the root node in the list to begin traversing the tree.
00347     nodeList.append( m_data->getRootNode() );
00348 
00349     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00350     //
00351     // Description:   This loop traverses through the tree breadth
00352     //                first by using a queue.  It names each node
00353     //                successively.
00354     //
00355     // Precondition:  The root node of the tree is in the queue.
00356     // Postcondition: Each node in the tree is named alphabetically.
00357     //
00358     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00359     while ( !nodeList.empty() )
00360     {
00361         //Clear the name variable for the next name.
00362         name.clear();
00363 
00364         //Check if the name should be 2 letters long.  If it should, start with
00365         //the first letter.
00366         if ( firstLetter >= 'A' )
00367             name.append( QChar( firstLetter ) );
00368 
00369         //Append the second letter.
00370         name.append( QChar( secondLetter ) );
00371 
00372         //Check if the second letter is still before 'Z' in the alphabet.  If it
00373         //is, increment by 1 letter.
00374         if ( secondLetter < 'Z' )
00375             secondLetter++;
00376         //Otherwise, set the second letter back to 'A' and increment the first
00377         //letter by one.
00378         else
00379         {
00380             secondLetter = 'A';
00381             firstLetter++;
00382         }
00383 
00384         //Set the name of the node.
00385         nodeList.front()->s_name = name;
00386 
00387         //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00388         //
00389         // Description:   This loop adds all the immediate children of
00390         //                the current node to the queue.
00391         //
00392         // Precondition:  None.
00393         // Postcondition: All the immediate child nodes of the current
00394         //                node are appended to the queue.
00395         //
00396         //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00397         for ( i = 0; i < nodeList.front()->s_childList.size(); i++ )
00398             nodeList.append( nodeList.front()->s_childList[ i ] );
00399 
00400         //Pop the node at the front of the queue.
00401         nodeList.removeFirst();
00402     }
00403 
00404     emit repaint();
00405     emit retrace();
00406 }
00407 
00408 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00409 /// CTreeGraphModel::autoNumber
00410 ///
00411 /// @description  This function automatically numbers all the nodes with a
00412 ///               random integer between the min and max values, inclusive.
00413 /// @pre          None
00414 /// @post         All the nodes have had a value randomly assigned to them.
00415 ///
00416 /// @param min:   This is the minimum value a node may have.
00417 /// @param max:   This is the maximum value a node may have.
00418 ///
00419 /// @limitations  None
00420 ///
00421 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00422 void CTreeGraphModel::autoNumber( int min, int max )
00423 {
00424     //Seed the random number generator.
00425     srand( time( NULL ) );
00426     autoNumberHelper( min, max, m_data->getRootNode() );
00427     emit repaint();
00428     emit retrace();
00429 }
00430 
00431 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00432 /// CTreeGraphModel::autoNumberHelper
00433 ///
00434 /// @description  This function generates random values for the given node and
00435 ///               all its child nodes.
00436 /// @pre          None
00437 /// @post         The given node and all its children have a randomly generated
00438 ///               value within the given boundaries.
00439 ///
00440 /// @param min:   This is the minimum value a node may have.
00441 /// @param max:   This is the maximum value a node may have.
00442 /// @param node:  This is a pointer to the root of a subtree to generate random
00443 ///               values for the tree, iterating depth first.
00444 ///
00445 /// @limitations     None
00446 ///
00447 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00448 void CTreeGraphModel::autoNumberHelper( int min, int max, STreeNode *node )
00449 {
00450     if ( node == NULL )
00451         return;
00452 
00453     node->s_value = (double)( min + ( rand() % ( max - min + 1 ) ) );
00454     for ( int i = 0; i < node->s_childList.size(); i++ )
00455         autoNumberHelper( min, max, node->s_childList[ i ] );
00456 }
00457 
00458 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00459 /// CTreeGraphModel::createNewData
00460 ///
00461 /// @description  This function creates a new data set, deleting any old data.
00462 /// @pre          None
00463 /// @post         Any old data is deleted and a new data set is created.
00464 ///
00465 /// @limitations  None
00466 ///
00467 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00468 void CTreeGraphModel::createNewData()
00469 {
00470     //Check if there is an existing data set already and delete it if there is
00471     //one.
00472     if ( m_data != NULL )
00473     {
00474         delete m_data;
00475     }
00476     m_data = new CTreeGraph;
00477     realignData();
00478 }
00479 
00480 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00481 /// CTreeGraphModel::deleteNode
00482 ///
00483 /// @description  This function deletes the indicated node.
00484 /// @pre          None
00485 /// @post         The indicated node and all its children are deleted.
00486 ///
00487 /// @param node:  This is a pointer to the node that is to be deleted.
00488 ///
00489 /// @limitations  None
00490 ///
00491 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00492 void CTreeGraphModel::deleteNode( STreeNode *node )
00493 {
00494     if ( node == NULL )
00495         return;
00496 
00497     //Check if the indicated node is not the root node.  If not, remove the
00498     //indicated node from its parent's child list.
00499     if ( node->s_parent != NULL )
00500         node->s_parent->s_childList.removeAt(
00501             node->s_parent->s_childList.indexOf( node ) );
00502     //Otherwise, create a new root node.
00503     else
00504     {
00505         setRootNode( new STreeNode );
00506         realignData();
00507     }
00508 
00509     //Delete the indicated node.
00510     delete node;
00511 
00512     //Signal the canvas to redraw the model.
00513     emit quickEditOff();
00514     emit repaint();
00515     emit retrace();
00516 }
00517

00587 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00588 /// CTreeGraphModel::editNodePosition
00589 ///
00590 /// @description   This function updates the given node's position to the given
00591 ///                point.
00592 /// @pre           None
00593 /// @post          The position of the given node is updated.
00594 ///
00595 /// @param node:   This is a pointer to the node which is being moved.
00596 /// @param point:  This is the new position of the node.
00597 ///
00598 /// @limitations   None
00599 ///
00600 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00601 void CTreeGraphModel::editNodePosition( STreeNode *node, QPoint point )
00602 {
00603     //Check if the node is not NULL and update its position if it's not.
00604     if ( node != NULL )
00605     {
00606         node->s_position = point;
00607 
00608         //Check if the node has a parent node and resort the parent node's
00609         //child list if there is a parent.
00610         if ( node->s_parent != NULL )
00611             if ( sortChildNodes( node->s_parent ) )
00612                 emit retrace();
00613         emit repaint();
00614     }
00615 }

00667 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00668 /// CTreeGraphModel::editSubTreePosition
00669 ///
00670 /// @description    This function is called when a user is moving a node along
00671 ///                 with the subtree beneath it.
00672 /// @pre            None
00673 /// @post           The given node and its subtree have been shifted to the new
00674 ///                 point with all the children having the same relative
00675 ///                 position.
00676 ///
00677 /// @param parent:  This is a pointer to the node which is being shifted.
00678 /// @param point:   This is the new position of the given node.
00679 ///
00680 /// @limitations    None
00681 ///
00682 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00683 void CTreeGraphModel::editSubTreePosition( STreeNode *parent, QPoint point )
00684 {
00685     if ( parent == NULL )
00686         return;
00687 
00688     //Move the given node and its subtree.
00689     shiftSubTree( parent, point - parent->s_position );
00690 
00691     //Check if the node has a parent node and resort the parent node's
00692     //child list if there is a parent.
00693     if ( parent->s_parent != NULL )
00694         if ( sortChildNodes( parent->s_parent ) )
00695             emit retrace();
00696     emit repaint();
00697 }
00698 
00699 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00700 /// CTreeGraphModel::findMaxDepth
00701 ///
00702 /// @description  This function finds the maximum depth from the given node.
00703 ///               The given node is considered at a depth of 1.  Calling this
00704 ///               function on the root node gets the depth of the entire tree.
00705 /// @pre          None
00706 /// @post         None
00707 ///
00708 /// @param node:  This is a pointer to the node of a subtree which the depth
00709 ///               is being found.
00710 ///
00711 /// @return int:  Returns the depth below the given node, and 1 if the given
00712 ///               node is a leaf node.
00713 ///
00714 /// @limitations  None
00715 ///
00716 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00717 int CTreeGraphModel::findMaxDepth( STreeNode *node )
00718 {
00719     if ( node == NULL )
00720         return 0;
00721 
00722     int maxDepth = 0, tempDepth = 0;
00723     for ( int i = 0; i < node->s_childList.size(); i++ )
00724     {
00725         tempDepth = findMaxDepth( node->s_childList[ i ] );
00726         if ( tempDepth > maxDepth )
00727             maxDepth = tempDepth;
00728     }
00729     return ( maxDepth + 1 );
00730 }
00731 
00732 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00733 /// CTreeGraphModel::findNode
00734 ///
00735 /// @description          This function attempts to find any node located at the
00736 ///                       given point.  If the point exists inside a node, then
00737 ///                       a pointer to the node is returned.  If the point does
00738 ///                       not lie within a node, NULL is returned.
00739 /// @pre                  None
00740 /// @post                 None
00741 ///
00742 /// @param point:         This is the point where the user clicked.
00743 ///
00744 /// @return STreeNode *:  Returns a pointer to the node which contains the given
00745 ///                       point and NULL if no node contains the point.
00746 ///
00747 /// @limitations          None
00748 ///
00749 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00750 STreeNode * CTreeGraphModel::findNode( QPoint point )
00751 {
00752  STreeNode *node = NULL;
00753 
00754  int nodeRadius = m_style->getNodeRadius();
00755 
00756     //To save unnecessary computations, create a QRect around the point equal to
00757     //the size of a node and look for any node center points in the "virtual
00758     //node".
00759  QRect rect( 0, 0, nodeRadius * 2, nodeRadius * 2 );
00760  rect.moveCenter( point );
00761 
00762     //Recurse through the tree and find any nodes which contain the point.
00763  node = findNodeHelper( getRootNode(), rect );
00764 
00765  return node;
00766 }
00767 
00768 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00769 /// CTreeGraphModel::findNodeHelper
00770 ///
00771 /// @description          This function recursively calls itself so that the
00772 ///                       given node and all children nodes beneath it are
00773 ///                       searched for the center point of the given rect.
00774 /// @pre                  None
00775 /// @post                 None
00776 ///
00777 /// @param node:          This is a pointer to the node which is being checked
00778 ///                       for the given point.
00779 /// @param rect:          This is the rect around the point where the user
00780 ///                       clicked.  If the center of a node exists inside the
00781 ///                       rect, the point where the user clicked would be inside
00782 ///                       the node.
00783 ///
00784 /// @return STreeNode *:  Returns a pointer to the node which contains the given
00785 ///                       point and NULL if no node contains the point.
00786 ///
00787 /// @limitations          None
00788 ///
00789 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00790 STreeNode * CTreeGraphModel::findNodeHelper( STreeNode *node, QRect &rect )
00791 {
00792     if ( node == NULL )
00793         return NULL;
00794 
00795  STreeNode *returnNode = NULL;
00796 
00797     //Check if the rect contains the center of the given node.  If it does,
00798     //go through the computations to see if the center of the rect is actually
00799     //within the circle representing the node, and not just the bounding rect.
00800  if ( rect.contains( node->s_position ) )
00801  {
00802      //These variables are used to compute if the point is within the
00803      //node.
00804         quint32 dX, dY, radius;
00805 
00806         //Grab the X and Y distances from the point to the center of the
00807         //circle to compute 2 legs of the triangle.
00808         dX = abs(node->s_position.x() - rect.center().x());
00809         dY = abs(node->s_position.y() - rect.center().y());
00810 
00811   //Calculate the radius of the node.
00812         radius = rect.height() / 2;
00813 
00814   //Square the radius, X, and Y values.
00815         dX = dX * dX;
00816         dY = dY * dY;
00817         radius = radius * radius;
00818 
00819   //Check if the hypotenouse of the triangle formed by (0,0), (x,0), (0,y)
00820   //is less than radius.  Since squaring both the radius and hypotenouse
00821   //does not change which is greater than the other, do not take the
00822   //squareroot of each as this will cause additional unneeded computation.
00823         if (dX + dY <= radius)
00824         {
00825          //The point is in the node.
00826             returnNode = node;
00827         }
00828 
00829  }
00830 
00831     //Check if a node was found that contains the center of the rect or not.
00832  if ( returnNode == NULL )
00833  {
00834         //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00835         //
00836         // Description:   This loop calls this function recursively
00837         //                for all children nodes of the current node.
00838         //
00839         // Precondition:  None
00840         // Postcondition: A node was found, if the loop was broken.
00841         //
00842         //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00843   for ( int i = 0; i < node->s_childList.size(); i++ )
00844   {
00845    returnNode = findNodeHelper( node->s_childList[i], rect );
00846 
00847    if ( returnNode != NULL )
00848     break;
00849   }
00850  }
00851 
00852  return returnNode;
00853 }
00854 
00855 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00856 /// CTreeGraphModel::getContainingRect
00857 ///
00858 /// @description    This function returns a QRect which contains all the nodes
00859 ///                 currently in the graph.
00860 /// @pre            None
00861 /// @post           None
00862 ///
00863 /// @return QRect:  Returns a QRect which contains all the nodes.
00864 ///
00865 /// @limitations    None
00866 ///
00867 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00868 QRect CTreeGraphModel::getContainingRect() const
00869 {
00870     //Start the rect at the root node.
00871     QRect ret = getContainingRectHelper( m_data->getRootNode() );
00872 
00873     //Adjust the containing rect to take into account how the nodes are actually
00874     //drawn to the screen.
00875     int adjust = m_style->getNodeRadius() + m_style->getBoldWidth() +
00876                  m_style->getPen().width();
00877     ret.adjust( -adjust, -adjust, adjust, adjust );
00878     return ret;
00879 }
00880 
00881 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00882 /// CTreeGraphModel::getContainingRectHelper
00883 ///
00884 /// @description    This function returns a rect that contains the given node
00885 ///                 and all its children.  The rect does not take into account
00886 ///                 how the nodes are drawn to the screen, so it only contains
00887 ///                 the center points of the nodes.
00888 /// @pre            None
00889 /// @post           None
00890 ///
00891 /// @param parent:  This is a pointer to the node with which the function will
00892 ///                 return a containing rect for it and all its children.
00893 ///
00894 /// @return QRect:  Returns a rect containing the given node and all its
00895 ///                 children.
00896 ///
00897 /// @limitations    The returned rectangle does not encompass the history table.
00898 ///
00899 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00900 QRect CTreeGraphModel::getContainingRectHelper( STreeNode *parent ) const
00901 {
00902     if ( parent == NULL )
00903         return QRect();
00904     QRect ret( parent->s_position, QSize( 1,1 ) );
00905 
00906     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00907     //
00908     // Description:   This loop recursively calls this function on
00909     //                all the children of the given node to obtain
00910     //                a containing rect of the given node and its
00911     //                children.
00912     //
00913     // Precondition:  None
00914     // Postcondition: The containing rect includes all the children
00915     //                of the given node.
00916     //
00917     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00918     for ( int i = 0; i < parent->s_childList.size(); i++ )
00919         ret |= getContainingRectHelper( parent->s_childList[ i ] );
00920 
00921     return ret;
00922 }
00923 
00924 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00925 /// CTreeGraphModel::getHistoryPosition
00926 ///
00927 /// @description    This function returns a QPoint representint the upper left
00928 ///                 corner of the history table.
00929 /// @pre            None
00930 /// @post           None
00931 ///
00932 /// @return QPoint: Returns a QPoint representint the upper left corner of the
00933 ///                 history table.
00934 ///
00935 /// @limitations    Current hack to return the bottom left corner of the tree
00936 ///                 rectangle. This is in place because moving the history
00937 ///                 table is currently not implemented and using the bottom
00938 ///                 right corner ensures that the tree is never written over.
00939 ///
00940 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00941 QPoint CTreeGraphModel::getHistoryPosition() const
00942 {
00943     return getContainingRect().bottomLeft();
00944 }
00945 
00946 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00947 /// CTreeGraphModel::getHistoryTable
00948 ///
00949 /// @description    This function returns a QMap which contains all the nodes
00950 ///                 currently in the graph as keys and their history table
00951 ///                 history table values as values.
00952 /// @pre            None
00953 /// @post           None
00954 ///
00955 /// @return QMap:   Returns a QMap which contains all the nodes currently in
00956 ///                 the graph as keys and their history table
00957 ///                 history table values as values.
00958 ///
00959 /// @limitations    None
00960 ///
00961 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00962 HistoryTable CTreeGraphModel::getHistoryTable() const
00963 {
00964     HistoryTable ret;
00965     
00966     QList<STreeNode *> openList;
00967     openList = m_data->getRootNode()->s_childList;
00968     STreeNode *cur;
00969     STreeNode *i;
00970     
00971     while( openList.count() > 0 )
00972     {
00973         cur = openList.takeFirst();
00974         foreach( i, cur->s_childList )
00975             openList.append( i );
00976         if( cur->s_history != 0 )
00977             ret.append( HistoryValue(cur, cur->s_history) );
00978     }
00979     
00980     return ret;
00981 }
00982 
00983 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00984 /// CTreeGraphModel::getHistoryTableHelper
00985 ///
00986 /// @description    This function recursively does a DFS on the tree filling
00987 ///                 the table with all nodes and their values.
00988 /// @pre            None
00989 /// @post           None
00990 ///
00991 /// @param node:    This is a pointer to the current node in the depth first
00992 ///                 search. It will be added to the table and then the function
00993 ///                 will be recursively called on its children.
00994 /// @param table:   This is the history table in its current state as it is 
00995 ///                 filled.
00996 ///
00997 /// @limitations    None
00998 ///
00999 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01000 void CTreeGraphModel::getHistoryTableHelper( const STreeNode *node,
01001                       HistoryTable &table ) const
01002 {
01003 /*    if( node->s_history != 0 )
01004         table.insert( node, node->s_history );
01005     
01006     STreeNode *i;
01007     foreach( i, node->s_childList )
01008         getHistoryTableHelper( i, table );*/
01009 }

01011 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01012 /// CTreeGraphModel::getRootNode
01013 ///
01014 /// @description          This function returns a pointer to the root node of
01015 ///                       the tree, if it exists.
01016 /// @pre                  None
01017 /// @post                 None
01018 ///
01019 /// @return STreeNode *:  This is a pointer to the root node of the tree.
01020 ///
01021 /// @limitations          None
01022 ///
01023 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01024 STreeNode * CTreeGraphModel::getRootNode() const
01025 {
01026     STreeNode *node = NULL;
01027     if ( m_data != NULL )
01028         node = m_data->getRootNode();
01029 
01030     return node;
01031 }

01033 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01034 /// CTreeGraphModel::load
01035 ///
01036 /// @description      This function loads the data from the given file.
01037 /// @pre              None
01038 /// @post             The given file is loaded into the program.
01039 ///
01040 /// @param filename:  This is the filename to be loaded.
01041 ///
01042 /// @limitations      None
01043 ///
01044 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01045 void CTreeGraphModel::load( const QString &filename )
01046 {
01047     if ( m_data == NULL )
01048         createNewData();
01049 
01050     m_data->load( filename );
01051 }
01052 
01053 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01054 /// CPuzzleGraphModel::realignData
01055 ///
01056 /// @description      This function shifts the nodes so that all nodes are
01057 ///                   are painted in positive coordinates.
01058 /// @pre              None
01059 /// @post             The top left corner of every node is >= (0,0)
01060 ///
01061 /// @limitations      None
01062 ///
01063 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01064 void CTreeGraphModel::realignData()
01065 {
01066     QPoint shiftOffset = getContainingRect().topLeft();
01067     if( shiftOffset.x() >= 0 && shiftOffset.y() >= 0 )
01068         return;
01069 
01070     if( shiftOffset.x() > 0 )
01071         shiftOffset.setX( 0 );
01072     if( shiftOffset.y() > 0 )
01073         shiftOffset.setY( 0 );
01074 
01075     shiftSubTree( m_data->getRootNode(), -shiftOffset );
01076 
01077     emit repaint();
01078 }
01079 
01080 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01081 /// CTreeGraphModel::rehook
01082 ///
01083 /// @description    This function attaches the second node to tree as a child
01084 ///                 node of the first parameter.
01085 /// @pre            None
01086 /// @post           The node is attached to the parent.
01087 ///
01088 /// @param parent:  This is a pointer to the node which the other node is being
01089 ///                 attached to as the other node's parent.
01090 /// @param node:    This is a pointer to the node which is being reattached to
01091 ///                 the tree.
01092 ///
01093 /// @limitations    None
01094 ///
01095 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01096 void CTreeGraphModel::rehook( STreeNode *parent, STreeNode *node )
01097 {
01098     if ( parent == NULL || node == NULL )
01099         return;
01100 
01101     parent->s_childList.append( node );
01102     node->s_parent = parent;
01103     sortChildNodes( parent );
01104 
01105     emit repaint();
01106     emit retrace();
01107 }
01108

01115 ///
01116 /// @param filename:  This is the filename to save the data to.
01117 ///
01118 /// @limitations      None
01119 ///
01120 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01121 void CTreeGraphModel::save( const QString &filename ) const
01122 {
01123     if ( m_data != NULL )
01124         m_data->save( filename );
01125 }

01127 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01128 /// CTreeGraphModel::setRootNode
01129 ///
01130 /// @description  This function sets the root node of the tree to the indicated
01131 ///               node.
01132 /// @pre          None
01133 /// @post         The root node of the tree has been updated if a data set
01134 ///               exists.
01135 ///
01136 /// @param node:  This is a pointer to the new root node.
01137 ///
01138 /// @limitations  None
01139 ///
01140 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01141 void CTreeGraphModel::setRootNode( STreeNode *node )
01142 {
01143     if ( m_data != NULL )
01144         m_data->setRootNode( node );
01145 }
01146 
01147 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01148 /// CTreeGraphModel::shiftSubTree
01149 ///
01150 /// @description    This function shifts the given node and all its children by
01151 ///                 the given point.
01152 /// @pre            None
01153 /// @post           The given node and all its children are shifted by the given
01154 ///                 amount.
01155 ///
01156 /// @param parent:  This is a pointer to the parent node which is being shifted.
01157 /// @param point:   This point contains the offset to shift the given node and
01158 ///                 all its children by.
01159 ///
01160 /// @limitations    None
01161 ///
01162 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01163 void CTreeGraphModel::shiftSubTree( STreeNode *parent, QPoint point )
01164 {
01165     if ( parent == NULL )
01166         return;
01167 
01168     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01169     //
01170     // Description:   This loop recursively calls this function for
01171     //                each child node of the given node in order to
01172     //                shift the entire sub tree.
01173     //
01174     // Precondition:  None
01175     // Postcondition: All child nodes below the given node are
01176     //                shifted by the given amount.
01177     //
01178     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01179     for ( int i = 0; i < parent->s_childList.size(); i++ )
01180     {
01181         shiftSubTree( parent->s_childList[i], point );
01182     }
01183     parent->s_position = parent->s_position + point;
01184 }
01185 
01186 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01187 /// CTreeGraphModel::sortChildNodes
01188 ///
01189 /// @description    This function sorts the child node list of the given node
01190 ///                 so that the order of the list is the order the nodes appear
01191 ///                 on the screen, from left to right.
01192 /// @pre            None
01193 /// @post           The given node's child node list is sorted.
01194 ///
01195 /// @param parent:  This is a pointer to the parent node whose child list needs
01196 ///                 to be sorted.
01197 ///
01198 /// @return bool:   Returns true if the child list was resorted and false if the
01199 ///                 list was already sorted.
01200 ///
01201 /// @limitations    None
01202 ///
01203 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01204 bool CTreeGraphModel::sortChildNodes( STreeNode *parent )
01205 {
01206     bool listChanged = false;
01207     //Check to make sure the given node is not NULL, and return if it is.
01208     if ( parent == NULL )
01209         return false;
01210 
01211     int minIndex;
01212 
01213     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01214     //
01215     // Description:   This loop sorts through the child list of the
01216     //                given node and sorts them from left to right,
01217     //                based on their position.  This is done by
01218     //                iterating through the list and finding the
01219     //                smallest X position and placing it at the start
01220     //                of the list.  Then the 2nd smallest value is
01221     //                found, and so on and so forth.
01222     //
01223     // Precondition:  None
01224     // Postcondition: The child nodes are sorted.
01225     //
01226     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01227     for ( int i = 0; i < parent->s_childList.size(); i++ )
01228     {
01229         minIndex = i;
01230         for ( int j = i + 1; j < parent->s_childList.size(); j++ )
01231         {
01232             if ( parent->s_childList[j]->s_position.x() <
01233                  parent->s_childList[minIndex]->s_position.x() )
01234             {
01235                 minIndex = j;
01236             }
01237         }
01238 
01239         //Only swap if the value isn't at the proper spot in the list already.
01240         if ( minIndex != i )
01241         {
01242             parent->s_childList.swap( minIndex, i );
01243             listChanged = true;
01244         }
01245     }
01246     return listChanged;
01247 }
01248 
01249 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01250 /// CTreeGraphModel::unhook
01251 ///
01252 /// @description  This function unhooks the given node from the tree.
01253 /// @pre          None
01254 /// @post         The given node is removed from the tree.
01255 ///
01256 /// @param node:  This is a pointer to the node which is to be unhooked from the
01257 ///               tree.
01258 ///
01259 /// @limitations  None
01260 ///
01261 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01262 void CTreeGraphModel::unhook( STreeNode *node )
01263 {
01264     if ( node == NULL )
01265         return;
01266 
01267     node->s_parent->s_childList.removeAt(
01268         node->s_parent->s_childList.indexOf( node ) );
01269     node->s_parent = NULL;
01270 
01271     emit repaint();
01272     emit retrace();
01273 }
